heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.6°C), outside temperature (down 9.4°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 400 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.8°C), cloud levels (up 381 m), and inside temperature (up 4.2°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 399.9m lower than yesterday, 267.6m lower than the past week, 380.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 993m to 2630m and averaged 1222.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; extremely cold temperatures will prevail. Also, near calm conditions. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and it’s dim outside. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.1°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
